intro: Barthea barthei var. lilungshaniana, commonly known as the Lilungshan barthea, is a rare and striking plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, elongated pseudobulbs and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces inflorescences with pendulous, white to pale yellow blooms that are often adorned with a deep purple or brown lip. It thrives in cool, shaded environments with high humidity, making it a challenging but rewarding species for experienced growers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
